summary: This is an internal child exploitation case update report from the U.S. Department of Justice, dated February 25, 2021. It lists cases coded 080 or 087 and includes specific entries for the cases against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, noting key dates, charges, and case statuses such as Epstein's death and the withdrawal of his appeal.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as a defendant in case 19-CR-00490, indicted on July 2, 2019, for alleged trafficking and enticement of minors. The case was dismissed without prejudice on August 29, 2019, following his death by suicide.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as a defendant in case 20-CR-00330, indicted on June 29, 2020, on multiple charges including public corruption, with a victim/witness flag marked 'Y'.

connections.description: Both are listed as defendants in related federal cases concerning the alleged trafficking and enticement of minors, indicating a legal association in the same criminal investigation.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Indictment
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted on charges related to alleged trafficking and enticement of minors.

events.title: Appeal Withdrawal Mandate
events.description: The U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit issued a mandate ordering the withdrawal of Epstein's appeal (19-2221) per a stipulation by the parties under FRAP 42.

events.title: Epstein Case Dismissal and Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's case (19-CR-00490) was dismissed without prejudice by the government with DOJ authorization. The document notes 'Nolle, suicide 8/29/19'.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Indictment
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on multiple charges including public corruption.

keyFacts: The document is a DOJ internal report tracking child exploitation cases (coded 080 or 087) as of February 25, 2021.
It records that Jeffrey Epstein's federal criminal case (19-CR-00490) was dismissed without prejudice on August 29, 2019, following his death by suicide on the same date.
It records that an appeal in Epstein's case (19-2221) was withdrawn by stipulation of the parties, with a mandate issued by the Second Circuit on August 21, 2019.
It lists Ghislaine Maxwell as a defendant in case 20-CR-00330, indicted on June 29, 2020, with a victim/witness flag marked 'Y'.
The report instructs Lead AUSAs to review their assigned cases, close inactive ones promptly, and return updates to offices in St. Andrew's and White Plains.
